# Order of Succession In the unfortunate scenario the [color=#1b67a5]Captain[/color] of the station dies or becomes incapacitated, someone must take up the position. In case this scenario occurs, [color=#009100]Nanotrasen Central Command[/color] has set forward the following Order of Succession to appoint an [color=#1b67a5]Acting Captain[/color]. Continue down the list if the personnel is dead, incapacitated, or unwilling to take the position.
[bold]1.[/bold] [color=#9fed58]Head of Personnel[/color]
[bold]2.[/bold] [color=#cb0000]Head of Security[/color]
[bold]3.[/bold] [color=#c96dbf]Research Director[/color]
[bold]4.[/bold] [color=#5b97bc]Chief Medical Officer[/color]
[bold]5.[/bold] [color=#f39f27]Chief Engineer[/color]
[bold]6.[/bold] [color=#b18644]Quartermaster[/color]
[bold]7.[/bold] [color=#1b67a5]Acting Command Members[/color] with the same priority as above.
[bold]8.[/bold] [color=#cb0000]Magistrate[/color]
[bold]9.[/bold] [color=#009100]Nanotrasen Representative[/color]
[bold]10.[/bold] Any [color=#009100]Internal Affairs Agents[/color]
Anyone who becomes [color=#1b67a5]Captain[/color] via Succession must step down should an [color=#1b67a5]NT approved Captain[/color] arrive or return to active duty. They are permitted (but not required) to step down should someone higher on the list be available to take the position.
Example 1: [color=#1b67a5]Captain[/color] arrives on station, [color=#9fed58]HoP[/color] must step down.
Example 2: [color=#cb0000]HoS[/color] arrives on station, [color=#f39f27]CE[/color] is not required to step down.
Any [color=#1b67a5]Acting Captain[/color] must be sworn in by a [color=#009100]Central Command V.I.P.[/color] or the next highest member in the order of succession should there be no [color=#009100]Central Command V.I.P.[/color] available. An exception is made if the alert level is NOT Green or Blue.
The [color=#5b97bc]Chief Medical Officer[/color] or [color=#cb0000]Head of Security[/color] (including [color=#5b97bc]Acting CMO[/color] or [color=#cb0000]Acting HoS[/color]) can declare a [color=#1b67a5]Captain[/color] (or [color=#1b67a5]Acting Captain[/color]) unfit for duty with the agreement of 3 additional [color=#1b67a5]Command[/color] members (including [color=#1b67a5]Acting Command[/color]) or a simple majority of [color=#1b67a5]Command[/color] (including [color=#1b67a5]Acting Command[/color]). A document describing the reasons for the declaration must be signed by all involved personnel and either faxed to [color=#009100]Central Command[/color] or delivered to a [color=#009100]Central Command V.I.P.[/color] as soon as possible.
## Order of Succession OOC Rules
Do NOT force people to take the position of captain. This is both rude and against the policy.
If you take the position of captain you must be ready to be captain, including the extra scrutiny it comes with.
